intro: Onobrychis scapiformis, commonly known as the scapiform sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant has trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Onobrychis scapiformis is adapted to dry, calcareous soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
